PIPETTE; Kiss me I Oh dear, oh dear - I don’t
know what people will say,
WITCH; I do. They’ll say you quiet ones are
the worst. And you are.
BOOMBLEHARDT ENTERS
PIPETTE: Oh dear, here’s that disgusting old
wretch Boomblehardt. I hate the sight
fx. ’S')
_of him./(TO BOOMBLEHARDT) Kiss me!
© +o %~
t'V-Se-*"' * C*»c\
BOOMBLL; Eh? Certainly, my dear. (KISSES HER)
PIPETTE; How dare you! You insolent old man!
Yo'W f\\se.r h ;ser Kiss me! /

BOOIvIBLE: What, again? 'Why, of course!
(KISSES HER)
(3^ *
» V cXn
PIPETTE: Oh, you’re disgusting! (SLAPS HIM)
I’ll tell my aunt and you’ll be
banished from the village. Kiss me!
BOOMBLE: (RUBBING CHEEK) Thank you.but no
more this morning.
PIPETTE: Thank you, I’m sure. Oh dear, what
shall I do?
RUNS OFF FRANTICALLY, SAYING “KISS ME” ALL THE
WAY
BOOMBLE: (LOOKING AFTER PIPETTE) What a very
strange young girl!
